I still remember being a kid and playing this game with my siblings every day. Back then my home had no access to Wifi, so I grew up never even playing online. I only ever played split-screen and somehow this game managed to earn its title as my favorite zombie game. Would recommend buying L4D even if you have the sequel. Going back and playing the first after playing the second for so long felt like a completely different game.

This is hands down one of the BEST zombie games there is! I remember playing Left4Dead so much when I was a kid back on 360 days. I used to be so excited just to get back home from high school to get on and play this game. Those were the days! I played here on steam too. I have all it's achievements back on the 360 though. It was just a lot to do it again so that's why I don't have them on steam. However it is still fun! Just to bad my buddies I play with do not have PC so I can't play with them Left4dead on here. Either way, best zombie game ever!!!!!!!!

Left 4 Dead is a classic heart-pounding first-person shooter mixed with survival horror set in a modern world infested with a deadly virus. In the co-op mode, four "Survivors" will fight hordes of carnivorous zombies and mutant bosses. There are four large campaigns available in the game, each of which can be played together by a group of 1 to 4 people. Each campaign contains five large maps and some common task for the team. The zombie population in each mission is controlled by a special artificial intelligence called "The Director" ("the AI ‚Äã‚ÄãDirector"). It monitors the actions of the players and literally on the fly generates new survival conditions for the players based on their skill level.

In the multiplayer mode, players will shrink in a 4v4 mode, where four players are survivors and four are unique zombies, each with their own skill. Each team needs to play as smoothly as possible in order to pass the level as efficiently as possible and not let the horde of carnivorous dead devour themselves.
In my opinion this game is still the best at his genre since 2008, the effort and the dedication put into this game is amazing and it still so much fun till this day.

The zombie co-op game that started it all.

The story is minimal but also explained in great detail through environmental cues, disease breaks out, people freak out, and zombies roam the country, and you must be one of four survivors who must make it to the one safe haven in the east coast.

The co-op mechanics really make this game, you have to work together and play on each others strengths in order to make it, the zombies are also designed in very creative ways with their own abilities that you must overcome.

One of the strongest points of the game is the versus mode, you play through the story as normal but the enemy team play as the special infected and attempt to kill you, it's extremely fun especially with a full lobby.
10/10 game, its still fun years later, and looks very good for its time

This one is just a classic. I know some people would rather get L4D2 due to all the overhauls and content, but i just fancied a bit of the original. For a late 2008 game this racks more players than some of the present day titles, not surprising tbh. On max settings it holds up well and the audio, but noy so much with the players.

For the best experience it's probably best with friends. A few modes with the main being campaign, 6 missions to go through on multiple difficulty settings. Don't bother playing on expert without a solid team. You can spend a full day on just one mission. Unlike L4D2, the original doesn't have melee weapons and certain special infected, still a variety though. The second mode is survival. Pick form several locations in the campaign and defend until you can't. Achievements are there for reaching decent times. The third mode is Versus. Versus you can play as survivor or infected. Survivor needs to try and finish mission as the infected try and stop that from happening. Depending on times of day some modes are gonna be more popular than others.

Now L4D can be good but but there are too many Cu***. You could be 3 hours into a campaign and then someone decides to kill everyone. Hilarious. Problem today is Online is ruined, just abused by twa** what don't deserve to have internet in my opinion. Just be prepared when playing with randoms.

+Pros
+Still popular over 13 years on.
+A lot of replay ability.
+Audio good.
+Graphics still decent in my opinion.
+Funny characters.
+Story is there.

-Cons
-One of the worst player bases. Nice folk are here though, just rare to catch.
-AI a little dumb from time to time.

Overall rating *7/10* Fun to be had but just a shame as usual about the players.

An "old" version of L4D2 but still a good game
